intro: Trachydium wolffianum, commonly known as the Wolffian trachydium, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Trachydium wolffianum is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to the unique flora of the Canary Islands.
